Detailed Description

CPerspective Camera calibration and 3D->2D/2D->3D perspective methods, Last updated 1/11/2002.

Contains a normal linear camera calibration, corresponding 3D-2D points must be available as input to the calibration routine. In addition to the normal linear calibration, a radial distortion parameter k can be estimated by calling the method CalibrateWithRadialDist(). The distortion is described as: Dx=kx(x^2+y^2) and Dy=ky(x^2+y^2), where the point (x,y) is according to the center of the image. It could be discussed if the optical center (xh,yh) should be used instead, but for various reasons we use the image center at the moment. A set of methods is provided for dealing with the radial distortion after calibration, most important are: Calc3DTo2DRad(), RemoveRadialDistortion(), GetPosRadRemoved(), and GetPosInverseRad(). With these methods it is possible to find correspondance between image points and 3D points including the radial distortion parameter, when using the same camera. Example: 

        // The container holding the corresponding 3D-2D values.
        CCorresponding3D2DPoints PointSets;

        // Insert some code that fill out the PointSets variable with at least six sets
        // .... 

        // Creates a CPerspective object, setting image size
        CPerspective Persp(768,576);

        if (Persp.CalibrateWithRadialDist(PointSets)==false)
        {
                // print the calibration result
                cout << Persp << endl;
                cout << "Creating image without radial distortion..." << endl;
                CImage Source,Dest;
                Source.Load("a_source_image_to_be_interpreted.bmp");
                // Remove radial distortion from whole image
                // Note: It is a time consuming operation, if possible stay in original
                // image and use GetPosRadRemoved() to get positions without radial
                // distortion
                Persp.RemoveRadialDistortion(Dest,Img,false);
                // Dest now contains image without radial distortion
                Dest.Save("NoRadialDistortion.bmp");
                // let's say an algorithm finds a relevant point P in Dest
                CPoint2D<FLOAT32> P(100,200); // A point found in Dest
                // Can now get direction in 3D world coordinates
                CPoint3D<FLOAT32> Dir;
                Persp.Direction(P,Dir);
                // Position in original image (POriginal) can also be found
                CPoint2D<FLOAT32> POriginal;
                POriginal=Persp.GetPosInverseRad(P);
        }
        else
                cout << "Calibration failed" << endl;

Note: Since version 1.34, this class has undergone a major rewrite. The image size is now given to the constructor. A bug fix means that the radial distortion parameter found is better, it is highly recommended to use versions of this class later than 1.34. To preserve backward compatibility, the old methods are still available - but don't use them in your future programs, stick to the new ones. Documentation for old methods are only available in the header file, not on the web pages.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.50
Author:
Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk), Brian Kirstein (kirstein@protana.com) and René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)

Member Function Documentation

bool ipl::CPerspective::Calc3DTo2D (  const CPoint3D< FLOAT32 > &    w,
CPoint2D< FLOAT32 > &    Pnt
)  const
 

Finds the 2D position in image with origo in upper left corner, from a given 3D position and the precalculated camera matrix.

The method Calibrate() must be called first.

Parameters:
w  World coordinate.
Pnt  Position in image returned in this parameter.
Returns :
False, if the camera matrix has not been calculated.
See also:
Calc3DTo2DRad

bool ipl::CPerspective::Calc3DTo2DRad (  const CPoint3D< FLOAT32 > &    w,
CPoint2D< FLOAT32 > &    Pnt
)  const
 

Finds the 2D position in image from a given 3D position, the camera matrix and the distortion parameter k.

Use this function when working with an image not corrected for the radial distortion and a camera matrix and k-value calculated by one of the functions CalibrateWithRadialDist() or FindMarksAutoGlobalThreshold(). For a given 3D world position you will get the corresponding point in your original radial distorted image.

Parameters:
w  World coordinate.
Pnt  Position in image with origo in upper left corner, returned in this parameter.
Returns :
False, if calibration with radial distortion has not been performed.
See also:
Calc3DTo2D

Referenced by ErrorsToStream(), and GetErrors().

bool ipl::CPerspective::Calibrate (  const CCorresponding3D2DPoints &    PointSets ) 
 

Calibrates the camera matrix as given in Gonzalez & Woods page 67.

This is a simple linear calibration, call CalibrateWithRadialDist() to get a calibration with radial distortion included. 3D world coordinates and corresponding 2D ccd coordinates are given in parameter in order to calibrate. If succesfull, parameters are calculated by calling MatrixToParameters().

Parameters:
PointSets  3D and 2D corresponding coordinates, all entries must be complete, ie. an entry where either the 2D or 3D point is not used is not accepted.
Returns :
False, if corresponding point sets is less than 6, or if the PointSets contains non complete entries.
See also:
CalibrateWithRadialDist , MatrixToParameters

Definition at line 95 of file perspective.cpp.

References ipl::CCorresponding3D2DPoints::GetConstT3D2DPointsPtr(), m_Cam, m_CamMatrixCalibrated, and MatrixToParameters().

bool ipl::CPerspective::CalibrateWithRadialDist (  CCorresponding3D2DPoints &    PointSets ) 
 

Performs a normal calibration as the corresponding Calibrate() method.

In addition to that a radial distortion parameter k is estimated, see general comments for more information. Note: If you don't want distortion corrections just use the normal Calibrate() method. If succesfull, parameters are calculated by calling MatrixToParameters().

Parameters:
PointSets  Contains the sets of corresponding 2D and 3D coordinates, at least 6 must be present.
Returns :
False, if corresponding point sets is less than 6, or if the PointSets contains non complete entries.
See also:
MatrixToParameters

either Calibrate() or CalibrateWithRadialDist().

Returns :

bool ipl::CPerspective::CamParametersToStream (  ostream &    Stream )  const
 

Prints the camera parameters contined in the m_Par attribute to "stream".

These parameters are calculated by the method MatrixToParameters(), if it has not yet been calculated an error is streamed instead.

Parameters:
Stream  The ostream to stream the output to.
Returns :
False, if a calibration and MatrixToParameters() has not been performed yet.

bool ipl::CPerspective::Direction (  const CPoint2D< FLOAT32 > &    p,
CPoint3D< FLOAT32 > &    Dir
)  const
 

Calculates direction from p through Pinhole.

Parameters:
p  Position in 2D image with origo in upper left corner. If radial distortion is included in the calibration, the user must ensure that p is a position without radial distortion.
Dir  3D direction returned in this parameter. The vector is normalized, i.e. has length one.
Returns :
False, if the camera matrix has not been calculated.

bool ipl::CPerspective::GetErrors (  const CCorresponding3D2DPoints &    PointSets,
vector< CPoint2D< FLOAT32 > > &    Errors
) 
 

Returns a list of errors, in the Error parameter, for each point when the 3D world points are projected to image points using the camera matrix and radial distortion parameter (if radial calibration has been performed.

For visual inspection of errors call PrintErrors() or ErrorsToStream().

Parameters:
PointSets  Corresponding 3D-2D point sets.
Errors  A vector containing all errors, previous content of the vector is deleted.
Returns :
False, if no calibration is available.
See also:
PrintErrors() , ErrorsToStream()

CPoint2D< int > ipl::CPerspective::GetMaxRadialDisplacement (    )  const
 

Returns the maximum radial distortion displacement for a postion in image with given distortion parameter k.

Done by displacing a corner position which is the position furthest away from center.

Returns :
Maximum displacement relative to center of image.

Definition at line 407 of file perspective.cpp.

References CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), m_CenterX, m_CenterY, m_k, m_RadCalibrationPerformed, T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

CPoint2D< FLOAT32 > ipl::CPerspective::GetPosInverseRad (  FLOAT32    xr,
FLOAT32    yr
)  const
 

For a given position (x,y) a new inverse radial corrected position is returned, that is the position in a corresponding image with radial distortions.

Center of radial distortion is assumed to be center of image. This functionality is the opposite of GetPosRadRemoved().

Parameters:
xr  The position in horisontal direction. Origo in upper left corner.
yr  The position in vertical direction. Origo in upper left corner.
Returns :
Inverse radial corrected 2d position. Origo in upper left corner.
See also:
GetPosRadRemoved

Definition at line 390 of file perspective.cpp.

References m_CenterX, m_CenterY, m_k, m_RadCalibrationPerformed, T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

Same as GetPosRadRemoved, but here parameters are given as CPoint2D types.

Parameters:
Pos  The position to be corrected.
Returns :
Radial corrected 2d position. Origo in upper left corner.
See also:
GetPosRadRemoved

Definition at line 373 of file perspective.cpp.

References CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), m_CenterX, m_CenterY, m_k, m_RadCalibrationPerformed, T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

CPoint2D< FLOAT32 > ipl::CPerspective::GetPosRadRemoved (  FLOAT32    x,
FLOAT32    y
)  const
 

For a given position (x,y) a new radial corrected position is returned, that is the position in a corresponding image without radial distortions.

The inverse correction is performed by InverseRadialMove.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction to be corrected. Origo in upper left corner.
y  The position in vertical direction to be corrected. Origo in upper left corner.
Returns :
Radial corrected 2d position.
See also:
InverseRadialMove

double ipl::CPerspective::GetRadDistParameter (    )  const [inline]
 

Returns the radial distortion parameter contained in the attribute m_k.

Note: If calibration with radial distortion has not yet been performed the value is undefined. Use RadCalibrationPerformed() to check if it is available.

TCameraMatrix * ipl::CPerspective::GetTCameraMatrixPtr (    )  [inline]
 

Gets the camera matrix pointer to the attribute m_Cam.

Use this method to manipulate the camera matrix on your own. The fields starts from "a11" and goes to "a44". Note: Use RadCalibration() to check if it is available.

Returns :
The camera matrix.
See also:
GetConstTCameraMatrixPtr

Definition at line 579 of file perspective.h.

References m_Cam.

bool ipl::CPerspective::Load (  const char *    pPathAndFileName ) 
 

Load camera matrix and distortion parameter from file.

Camera parameters are calculated, if loading succeeds, by calling MatrixToParameters. Tokens in file are: PerspectiveVersion, the perspective class version (double) Width, image width. Height, image heigh. CameraMatrix, the 4*4 camera matrix (12 doubles) k, distortion parameter (double). If not available the appropriate attributes is set in this class. If version of calibration file is different than this class version, a warning is given. Comment lines starts with a '#' character, can be placed everywhere. Note: This methods is only available for the C++ part.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path.
Returns :
False, if file could not be opened or if the format is not correct.
Version:
0.9

Definition at line 636 of file perspective.cpp.

References TCameraMatrix::a11, TCameraMatrix::a12, TCameraMatrix::a13, TCameraMatrix::a14, TCameraMatrix::a21, TCameraMatrix::a22, TCameraMatrix::a23, TCameraMatrix::a24, TCameraMatrix::a31, TCameraMatrix::a32, TCameraMatrix::a33, TCameraMatrix::a34, TCameraMatrix::a41, TCameraMatrix::a42, TCameraMatrix::a43, TCameraMatrix::a44, m_Cam, m_CamMatrixCalibrated, m_CenterX, m_CenterY, m_k, m_RadCalibrationPerformed, m_Version, and MatrixToParameters().

bool ipl::CPerspective::MatrixToParameters (    )  [virtual]
 

Derives the camera parameters from a precalculated camera matrix using the method presented in the PhD Thesis "Industrial Vision" by Ole Knudsen, 1997, chapter 2.2.

The results are stored in the attribute m_Par. In addition the public attribute m_CamParametersAvailable is set to true.

Returns :
False, if the camera matrix has not been calculated.
Version:
0.6
Author:
Implementation by Brian Kirstein Ramsgaard (kirstein@protana.com).
See also:
m_Par

References m_Cam, m_CamMatrixCalibrated, m_CamParametersAvailable, and m_Par.

Referenced by Calibrate(), CalibrateWithRadialDist(), and Load().

CPerspective & ipl::CPerspective::operator= (  const CPerspective &    Source ) 
 

Overloading of assignment operator.

All information is copied to the destination. Previous data in this object are destroyed. An error is produced if both sides of the assignment operator is the same object.

bool ipl::CPerspective::RemoveRadialDistortion (  CStdImage &    Dest,
CStdImage &    Source,
bool    PreserveImageSize
) 
 

Removes the radial distortion k from the image.

Parameters:
Dest  Destination of new image, may be the same as Source. Note: In case of same source and destination the algorithm is a bit slower.
Source  Source image, may be the same as Dest. Note: In case of same source and destination the algorithm is a bit slower.
PreserveImageSize  if true, the destination image has same dimensions as source. Otherwise the new image will have the dimension needed to represent the radial corrected image without loss of information.
Returns :
False, if Img is not an 8 bit gray tone image.

Definition at line 277 of file perspective.cpp.

References ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), m_k, and m_RadCalibrationPerformed.

bool ipl::CPerspective::RemoveRadialDistortionExtK (  CStdImage &    Dest,
CStdImage &    Source,
double    k,
bool    PreserveImageSize
) 
 

Removes the radial distortion from the image with an external calculated k value.

When using this method, the camera need not be calibrated with the methods in this class.

Parameters:
Dest  Destination of new image, may be the same as Source. Note: In case of same source and destination the algorithm is a bit slower.
Source  Source image, may be the same as Dest. Note: In case of same source and destination the algorithm is a bit slower.
k  The radial distortion parameter.
PreserveImageSize  if true, the destination image has same dimensions as source. Otherwise the new image will have the dimension needed to represent the radial corrected image without loss of information.
Returns :
False, if a radial calibration has not been performed yet.

Definition at line 300 of file perspective.cpp.

References ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), and m_CamMatrixCalibrated.

bool ipl::CPerspective::Save (  const char *    pPathAndFileName,
const char *    pComments = NULL
)  const
 

Save camera matrix, distortion parameter and version number of this calibration class.

If no calibration data available, a message is written to cerr. If radial distortion has not been calibrated, the distortion parameter is not written to file. Note: This methods is only available for the C++ part.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file and relative or absolute path. If no extension is supplied in the filename a "cfg" extension is automatically added.
Comments  Extra comments to be added to the beginning of the file. No need to insert a leading '#', the method will do that. If you want more than one line use '
' control character to split.
Returns :
False, if file could not be opened for writing or if no calibration data available.
Version:
0.9

bool ipl::CPerspective::Set (  const TCameraMatrix &    Cam,
double    k,
unsigned int    Width,
unsigned    Height
) 
 

Sets all parameters in this class, previous values are destroyed.

The internal attributes m_CamMatrixCalibrated and m_RadCalibrationPerformed are set to true. Note: Camera parameters are not calculated, must call MatrixToParameters() to make them available.

Definition at line 112 of file perspective.cpp.

References m_Cam, m_CamMatrixCalibrated, m_CamParametersAvailable, m_CenterX, m_CenterY, m_k, and m_RadCalibrationPerformed.

void ipl::CPerspective::SetCameraMatrix (  const TCameraMatrix &    Cam ) 
 

Sets the camera matrix attribute to the values suplied in Cam.

Use this method if you want to provide an external camera matrix to this class. The internal attribute m_CamMatrixCalibrated is set to true and m_RadCalibrationPerformed is set to false.

Parameters:
Cam  Camera matrix, members are a11, a12, .... a44.

Definition at line 124 of file perspective.cpp.

References m_Cam, m_CamMatrixCalibrated, m_CamParametersAvailable, and m_RadCalibrationPerformed.

void ipl::CPerspective::SetCameraMatrixAndRadDistortion (  const TCameraMatrix &    Cam,
double    k
) 
 

Sets the camera matrix attribute to the values suplied in Cam and the radial distortion value m_k to the suplied k.

Use this method if you want to provide an external camera matrix and radial distortion parameter to this class. The internal attributes m_CamMatrixCalibrated and m_RadCalibrationPerformed are set to true.

Parameters:
Cam  Camera matrix, members are a11, a12, .... a44
k  Radial distortion parameter

bool ipl::CPerspective::SetImageDimensions (  unsigned int    Width,
unsigned int    Height
) 
 

Changes the image dimensions used in this class.

When calling this, all previous calibration is canceled since the radial distortion parameter was found according to original image center, hence a new calibration is needed.

Returns :
False, if Width or Height is zero. Only available in C++.
